document.masterDocTitle: The stigmaeid mites (Acari: Stigmaeidae) of Kelkit Valley (Turkey)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The stigmaeid mites (Acari: Stigmaeidae) of Kelkit Valley (Turkey)

bibRefCitation.author: Summers
bibRefCitation.refString: Summers, F. M. (1962) The genus Stigmaeus (Acarina: Stigmaeidae). Hilgardia, 33, 491 - 537.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female (
Figures 24
, 25 ). Length of body 398 ( 390–405 ), width 200 ( 190–210 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 24.
Stigmaeus glabrisetus
female—A, dorsal view of idiosoma; B, ventral view of idiosoma; C, dorsal setae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dorsum. All dorsal shields with reticulum. Propodosomal shield with three pairs of setae and a pair of postocular bodies, 100 ( 95–105 ) in diameter, located between setae ve and sci . Eyes absent. Setae sce placed on small shields. These shields located near the propodosomal shield. Central shield with two pairs of setae. Setae e 1 placed on median zonal shields and setae e 2 located on lateral zonal shields. Setae d 2 located on marginal shields. Intercalary shield divided, with setae f 1 . Suranal shield entire, with two pairs of setae. Setae ve and c 2 long and flagelliform, other dorsal body setae spinulate distally. Dimensions of setae as follows:
vi 51
( 45–55 ); ve 88 ( 85–90 ); sci 41 ( 40– 45 ); sce 50 ( 48–53 ); c 1 45 ( 40–50 ); c 2 92 ( 88–95 ); d 1 43 ( 40–45 ); d 2 51 ( 45–55 ); e 1 35 ( 30–40 ); e 2 62 ( 55–68 ); f 1 56 ( 52–60 ); h 1 40 ( 37–43 ); h 2 55 ( 48–60 ). Distances between setae: vi-vi 31 ( 28–35 ); ve-ve 68 ( 65–70 ); vi-ve 45 ( 48– 50 ); sci-sci 136 ( 130–143 ); ve-sci 50 ( 45–55 ); sce-sce 178 ( 168–195 ); c 1 -c 1 65 ( 60–68 ); c 1 -d 1 80 ( 75–85 ); d 1 -d 1 79 ( 75–83 ); f 1 -f 1 100 ( 90–110 ); h 1 -h 1 39 ( 38–40 ); h 2 -h 2 90 ( 87–93 ); h 1 -h 2 29 ( 28–30 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 25.
Stigmaeus glabrisetus
female—A, leg I; B, leg II; C, leg III; D, leg IV; E, palp; F, ventral view of gnathosoma .

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter . Humeral shields bearing setae c 2 . The pattern on humeral shields similar to that of dorsal shields. Coxisternal shields separated, bearing three pairs of setae. Aggenital shield with three pairs of setae. Contiguous genital and pseudanal covers bearing four pairs of setae ( g 1 , ps 1 , ps 2 , ps 3 ). Dimensions of setae as follows: ag 1 10 ( 7–13 ); ag 2 11 ( 8–15 ); ag 3 10 ( 8–13 ); g 1 15 ( 13–18 ); ps 1 32 ( 30–35 ); ps 2 23 ( 20–28 ); ps 3 25 ( 23–28 ). All ventral shields with reticulum.

Legs . Leg I 225 ( 210–240 ), leg II 185 ( 175–193 ), leg III 155 ( 145–163 ), leg IV 190 ( 178–200 ). Chaetotaxy of leg segments as follows: coxae 2 – 2 – 2 – 2 , trochanters 1 – 1–2 – 1 , femora 6 – 5 – 3 – 2 , genua 4 (κ)– 4 (κ)– 1 – 1 , tibiae 7 (ϕ,ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ)– 6 (ϕρ), tarsi 14 (ω)– 10 (ω)– 8 (ω)– 8 (ω). Genua I and II with solenidion κ. All tarsi with solenidion ω. Macrosetae d 83 ( 78–90 ), setae l' 40 ( 38–43 ); ratio d / l' 2.1.

Gnathosoma .
Chelicera 135 ( 125–143 ), palp 140 ( 130–148 ). Subcapitulum with two pairs of adoral setae distally and two pairs of subcapitular setae proximally. Dimension of setae: m 15 ( 13–18 ); n 13 ( 10–15 ), distances between setae: m-m 16 ( 15–18 ); n-n 23 ( 20–25 ).

Remarks. This species was known only from the U.S.A. (
Summers 1962
). This is the second record of the species. The Turkish specimens resemble
Stigmaeus glabrisetus
in general appearance, but apodemal marking is not evident and the ratio d / l' is 2.6 in U.S. A specimens, but 2.1 in the Turkish specimens.
